definition: lit. the east wind blowing in a horse's ear (idiom)/fig. words one pays no heed to
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
ear/handle (archaeology)/and that is all (Classical Chinese)
surname Dong
east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
Sima Xiangru is meticulous and Mei Gao is fast (idiom)/to each his good points
lit. the heart of a sheep in the skin of a tiger (idiom)/fig. impressive in appearance but lacking in substance/braggart
clay ox, wooden horse (idiom); shape without substance/worthless object
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to say one thing but mean another/to dissimulate
to call sth a cow or a horse (idiom); it doesn't matter what you call it/Insult me if you want, I don't care what you call me.
small-minded
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
to offend people with unkind remarks (idiom)
a skulk of foxes, a pack of dogs (idiom)/a gang of rogues
lit. to point at the chicken while scolding the dog (idiom)/fig. to make indirect criticisms
to ride out hawking (idiom); to hunt
see 竹馬之交|竹马之交[zhu2 ma3 zhi1 jiao1]
to talk incessantly/to chatter on and on
to talk nonsense (idiom)/frivolous talk
